events.originalText: A hijacker deliberately drove a truck into crowds along Drottninggatan in Stockholm, Sweden, killing five people.
events.subtitle: 2017 Stockholm truck attack
events.headline: Hijacker kills five in truck attack in Stockholm, Sweden

events.originalText: First Chechen War: Russian paramilitary troops began a massacre of hundreds of civilians in Samashki, Chechnya.
events.subtitle: First Chechen War
events.headline: Russian paramilitary troops massacre civilians in Chechnya

events.originalText: Rwandan Civil War: The Rwandan genocide began a few hours after the assassination of President Juvénal Habyarimana (pictured), with hundreds of thousands killed in the following 100 days.
events.subtitle: Rwandan Civil War
events.headline: Rwandan genocide begins after President's assassination

events.originalText: Uganda–Tanzania War: Tanzanian forces defeated Ugandan troops and their Libyan allies at the Battle of Entebbe, opening the way for an advance on the Ugandan capital, Kampala.
events.subtitle: Uganda–Tanzania War
events.headline: Tanzanian forces defeat Ugandan troops in Entebbe battle

events.originalText: Communist forces overran the South Vietnamese town of Lộc Ninh.
events.subtitle: Viet Cong
events.headline: Communist forces overrun South Vietnamese town

events.originalText: Reverend Bruce W. Klunder was killed by a bulldozer while he was protesting the construction of a segregated school in Cleveland, Ohio, U.S.
events.subtitle: Bruce W. Klunder
events.headline: Reverend killed protesting segregated school in Cleveland

events.originalText: The Rodgers and Hammerstein musical South Pacific, based on Tales of the South Pacific by James Michener, opened on Broadway.
events.subtitle: Rodgers and Hammerstein
events.headline: Rodgers and Hammerstein musical South Pacific opens on Broadway

events.originalText: The United Nations established the World Health Organization to act as a coordinating authority on international public health.
events.subtitle: United Nations
events.headline: UN establishes World Health Organization for public health coordination

events.originalText: World War II: U.S. forces sank the Japanese battleship Yamato during Operation Ten-Go in the East China Sea.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: US forces sink Japanese battleship Yamato in East China Sea

events.originalText: Italian dictator Benito Mussolini survived an assassination attempt by Irishwoman Violet Gibson.
events.subtitle: Benito Mussolini
events.headline: Mussolini survives assassination attempt by Irishwoman

events.originalText: An Arctic expedition led by Norwegian explorer Fridtjof Nansen (pictured) reached 86°13.6′N, almost three degrees beyond the previous Farthest North latitude.
events.subtitle: Nansen's Fram expedition
events.headline: Arctic expedition reaches Farthest North latitude led by Nansen

events.originalText: American Civil War: Union forces defeated Confederate troops at the Battle of Shiloh, the bloodiest battle in U.S. history at the time, in Hardin County, Tennessee.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Union forces defeat Confederates in bloodiest battle at Shiloh

events.originalText: After a conclave lasting eighty days, the College of Cardinals elected Fabio Chigi as Pope Alexander VII (pictured).
events.subtitle: 1655 papal conclave
events.headline: College of Cardinals elects Fabio Chigi as Pope Alexander VII after 80-day conclave
